item.title: Childhood Dental Caries about 2X more likely if Vitamin D is less than 20 ng – review
item.description:
• A Systematic Review of the Relationship between Serum Vitamin D Levels and Caries in the Permanent Teeth of Children and Adolescents

A Systematic Review of the Relationship between Serum Vitamin D Levels and Caries in the Permanent Teeth of Children and Adolescents

Dentistry Journal Volume 12 Issue 4 10.3390/dj12040117

by Roxana Buzatu 1ORCID,Magda Mihaela Luca 2,* and Bogdan Andrei Bumbu 3

  • 1 Department of Dental Aesthetics, Faculty of Dental Medicine, “Victor Babes” University of Medicine and Pharmacy Timisoara, Revolutiei Boulevard 9, 300041 Timisoara, Romania

item.title: Malocclusions 5X higher risk if poor Vitamin D Receptor or low Vitamin D
item.description:
• Relationship in development of malocclusions to polymorphisms of selected vitamin D receptors
      • Malocclusion 5X more likely if low Vitamin D - June 2021
      • Dr. Price found a connection between dental problems and low Vitamin D and/or vitamin K in the 1930’s

Relationship in development of malocclusions to polymorphisms of selected vitamin D receptors

Adv Clin Exp Med. 2024 Feb 14. https://doi.org/10.17219/acem/169977 PDF behind a paywall

Marzena Dominiak 1, Anna Leszczyszyn 1, Izabela Łaczmańska 2, Monika Machoy 3, Hanna Gerber 4, Joseph Choukroun 5, Tomasz Gedrange 6, Sylwia Hnitecka 4

item.title: Early Childhood Caries 1.4 times more likely if 20-30 ng of Vitamin D – meta-analysis
item.description:
• The Association Between Vitamin D and Early Childhood Caries: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis

–-

The Association Between Vitamin D and Early Childhood Caries: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis

Oral Health Prev Dent. 2024 Jan 15;22(1):63-72. doi: 10.3290/j.ohpd.b4928565.

Shuaiqi Ji, Kai Zhao, Lei Ma, Xiaohang Chen, Dali Zheng, Youguang Lu

Purpose: Previous surveys have reported that children with vitamin D deficiency were likely to suffer from early childhood caries (ECC). The aim of this systematic review and meta-analysis was to determine 1. whether the status of vitamin D is intrinsically related to the occurrence of ECC and 2. the optimal level of vitamin D for the prevention of ECC.

item.title: Off Topic: Xylitol reduces cavities, preterm births, osteoporosis, RTI, obesity, diabetes, etc. - several studies
item.description:
• Xylitol reduced preterm births 40%, and cavities in their infants by 70% - Dec 2023
      • Oral and Systemic Effects of Xylitol Consumption - May 2019
      • Xylitol Chewing Gums reduced risk of dental caries by 3.7X - Dec 1995
      • Health benefits of xylitol - July 2020
      • Effects of xylitol chewing gum and candies on the accumulation of dental plaque: a systematic review Review - Oct 2021
      • Some of 100’s of Xylitol videos

Xylitol reduced preterm births 40%, and cavities in their infants by 70% - Dec 2023

Xylitol and the Gateway Microbiome
